{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Python Web (Django) Developer",
  "description": "eHealth4everyone is a digital health enterprise based in Nigeria (Africa) contributing to health service delivery using data science and information technology. At ehealth4everyone, our goal is saving lives and our approach is information and technology. We believe that if health is a right, proven digital health solutions and expertise such as ours should not be a privilege.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Python Web (Django) Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	We are looking for a long-term Python Web Developer with 3 years experience using Django (most preferred) and Flask frameworks while working with little or no supervision.
	The Python Developer will design and ship elegant python codes with the foresight to avoid performance, scalability, usability, maintainability, availability, and testability issues.
	Your primary focus will be the development of server-side logic, and robust application programming interfaces (APIs) to be consumed by the client-side. You will be working in a cross-functional team in an agile environment, a basic understanding of front-end technologies and DevOps is necessary as well.


Responsibilities


	Write effective, scalable code
	Develop backend components to improve responsiveness and overall performance
	Integrate user-facing elements into applications
	Test and debug programs
	Improve functionality of existing systems
	Implement security and data protection solutions
	Assess and prioritize feature requests
	Coordinate with internal teams to understand user requirements and provide technical solutions.


Qualification and Skills


	Must have a Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or any related subject.
	Candidates should have a minimum of three(3) year of experience.
	Django (preferred), Pyramid, FastAPI, or Flask frameworks.
	An ability to work on multiple projects and tasks at the same time.
	Ability to work effectively with great attention to detail &amp; highly organized.
	A detailed CV that contains links to previous/current projects, Social media &amp; Github accounts, and current communities of your membership. Applicants without these may not be considered.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "eHealth4everyone"
    
  },

Python Web (Django) Developer Job at eHealth4everyone




        
    

        
        eHealth4everyone is a digital health enterprise based in Nigeria (Africa) contributing to health service delivery using data science and information technology. At ehealth4everyone, our goal is saving lives and our approach is information and technology. We believe that if health is a right, proven digital health solutions and expertise such as ours should not be a privilege.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Python Web (Django) Developer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a long-term Python Web Developer with 3 years experience using Django (most preferred) and Flask frameworks while working with little or no supervision.
	The Python Developer will design and ship elegant python codes with the foresight to avoid performance, scalability, usability, maintainability, availability, and testability issues.
	Your primary focus will be the development of server-side logic, and robust application programming interfaces (APIs) to be consumed by the client-side. You will be working in a cross-functional team in an agile environment, a basic understanding of front-end technologies and DevOps is necessary as well.


Responsibilities


	Write effective, scalable code
	Develop backend components to improve responsiveness and overall performance
	Integrate user-facing elements into applications
	Test and debug programs
	Improve functionality of existing systems
	Implement security and data protection solutions
	Assess and prioritize feature requests
	Coordinate with internal teams to understand user requirements and provide technical solutions.


Qualification and Skills


	Must have a Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or any related subject.
	Candidates should have a minimum of three(3) year of experience.
	Django (preferred), Pyramid, FastAPI, or Flask frameworks.
	An ability to work on multiple projects and tasks at the same time.
	Ability to work effectively with great attention to detail & highly organized.
	A detailed CV that contains links to previous/current projects, Social media & Github accounts, and current communities of your membership. Applicants without these may not be considered.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Manager",
  "description": "At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly organized Project Manager to oversee construction projects from initiation to completion. The ideal candidate will ensure timely delivery, quality, and budget control while managing diverse teams and stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and supervise construction and design projects.
	Develop project timelines, budgets, and procurement schedules.
	Manage vendors, contractors, and internal teams for smooth execution.
	Monitor site activities to ensure compliance with quality and safety standards.
	Prepare progress reports, risk assessments, and project updates.
	Resolve issues, provide leadership, and drive process improvement.


Requirements


	B.Sc./B.Eng/B.Arch in Engineering, Architecture, Project Management, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in managing construction or infrastructure projects.
	PMP or PRINCE2 certification is an added advantage.
	Strong leadership, budgeting, and negotiation skills.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
	Must reside within the Lekki&ndash;Ajah axis for proximity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talentsync1@outlook.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Project Manager Job at Talent Sync Services




        
    

        
        At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager
Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly organized Project Manager to oversee construction projects from initiation to completion. The ideal candidate will ensure timely delivery, quality, and budget control while managing diverse teams and stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and supervise construction and design projects.
	Develop project timelines, budgets, and procurement schedules.
	Manage vendors, contractors, and internal teams for smooth execution.
	Monitor site activities to ensure compliance with quality and safety standards.
	Prepare progress reports, risk assessments, and project updates.
	Resolve issues, provide leadership, and drive process improvement.


Requirements


	B.Sc./B.Eng/B.Arch in Engineering, Architecture, Project Management, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in managing construction or infrastructure projects.
	PMP or PRINCE2 certification is an added advantage.
	Strong leadership, budgeting, and negotiation skills.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
	Must reside within the Lekki–Ajah axis for proximity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentsync1@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Civil Engineer",
  "description": "At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced Civil Engineer to join our growing team. The successful candidate will oversee planning, design, and execution of infrastructure and building projects while ensuring compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, plan, and supervise construction projects.
	Prepare engineering drawings, specifications, and cost estimates.
	Ensure adherence to building codes, safety regulations, and project timelines.
	Coordinate with architects, contractors, and stakeholders for smooth execution.
	Conduct site inspections and provide technical guidance.
	Prepare progress reports and recommend process improvements.


Requirements


	B.Sc./B.Eng in Civil Engineering or related field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of relevant experience in building/infrastructure projects.
	COREN certification or evidence of registration in progress is an advantage.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, or other civil engineering software.
	Excellent project management and communication skills.
	Must reside within the Lekki&ndash;Ajah axis for proximity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talentsync1@outlook.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

    }
  }
}



Civil Engineer Job at Talent Sync Services




        
    

        
        At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced Civil Engineer to join our growing team. The successful candidate will oversee planning, design, and execution of infrastructure and building projects while ensuring compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, plan, and supervise construction projects.
	Prepare engineering drawings, specifications, and cost estimates.
	Ensure adherence to building codes, safety regulations, and project timelines.
	Coordinate with architects, contractors, and stakeholders for smooth execution.
	Conduct site inspections and provide technical guidance.
	Prepare progress reports and recommend process improvements.


Requirements


	B.Sc./B.Eng in Civil Engineering or related field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of relevant experience in building/infrastructure projects.
	COREN certification or evidence of registration in progress is an advantage.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, or other civil engineering software.
	Excellent project management and communication skills.
	Must reside within the Lekki–Ajah axis for proximity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentsync1@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Development Manager - Alternative Fuels",
  "description": "Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group &ndash; the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Development Manager - Alternative Fuels

Requisition ID:&nbsp; 14406
Job Location:&nbsp;Ewekoro, Ogun
Job type: Full-time

About the Job


	The Development Manager for Alternative Fuels is responsible for driving the development, sourcing, and management of Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) as&nbsp;a sustainable alternative fuel for cement manufacturing.
	This role ensures the&nbsp;successful integration of MSW into operations while maintaining compliance with&nbsp;environmental regulations and optimizing cost efficiencies.
	Due to the operational&nbsp;intensity at the dumpsites, the role will also have a dotted reporting line to the&nbsp;Operations Manager, to ensure operational alignment and efficiency in the field.


What You&#39;ll be Doing&nbsp;
Business Development &amp; Growth:


	Identify and explore opportunities for sourcing MSW and other municipal waste materials for use as alternate fuels.
	Assist in preparing proposals and business cases for new waste streams&nbsp;and co-processing initiatives.
	Drive revenue growth by expanding Geocycle&rsquo;s customer and waste&nbsp;supplier portfolio across Nigeria.
	Conduct regular market intelligence and competitor analysis to inform&nbsp;strategic positioning.&nbsp;Stakeholder Engagement
	Engage with municipalities, waste contractors, and private waste collectors&nbsp;to secure MSW supply.
	Support relationship management with regulatory agencies and NGOs&nbsp;involved in waste and environmental matters.
	Support contract negotiations, MOUs, and partnerships that promote&nbsp;Geocycle&rsquo;s sustainable waste management initiatives.
	Work with internal teams across logistics, operations, and sustainability to&nbsp;support delivery of MSW alternate fuel goals.


Project Management &amp; Execution:


	Support implementation of new MSW supply streams, including site visits,&nbsp;quality checks, and coordination with operations teams.
	Monitor pre-processing and logistics to ensure material specifications are&nbsp;met for co-processing.
	Address operational bottlenecks in collaboration with field teams and&nbsp;logistics partners.


Compliance &amp; Risk Awareness:


	Ensure all business development activities align with Lafarge&rsquo;s HSE,&nbsp;sustainability, and ethical standards.
	Conduct due diligence on new partners and materials to mitigate&nbsp;operational and reputational risks.


Reporting &amp; Performance Monitoring:


	Track business development KPIs including volume sourced, customer&nbsp;retention, and cost efficiency.
	Prepare monthly reports and presentations for leadership and regional&nbsp;business reviews.
	Share insights and learnings from the field to inform continuous&nbsp;improvement.


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in&nbsp;Environmental Science,&nbsp;Engineering, Waste&nbsp;Management, Business&nbsp;Administration, or&nbsp;related field
	Minimum of 5&ndash;7 years of experience in municipal&nbsp;solid waste management, alternative fuels, or&nbsp;sustainability roles.
	Demonstrated expertise in project management,&nbsp;stakeholder engagement, and regulatory compliance
	Knowledge of safety rules and regulations
	Strong negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in waste processing technologies and waste-to-energy solutions.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Strong commercial acumen, stakeholder management, and project execution skills.
	Experience in the cement, energy, recycling, or manufacturing sector is highly desirable.


Key interfaces, stakeholders and relationships:


	Dotted Reporting Line &ndash; Geocycle Operations Manager
	The incumbent interacts regularly with all cadres of staff.

Development Manager - Alternative Fuels Job at Lafarge Africa Plc




        
    

        
        Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group – the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Development Manager - Alternative Fuels

Requisition ID:  14406
Job Location: Ewekoro, Ogun
Job type: Full-time

About the Job
     

            
    




	The Development Manager for Alternative Fuels is responsible for driving the development, sourcing, and management of Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) as a sustainable alternative fuel for cement manufacturing.
	This role ensures the successful integration of MSW into operations while maintaining compliance with environmental regulations and optimizing cost efficiencies.
	Due to the operational intensity at the dumpsites, the role will also have a dotted reporting line to the Operations Manager, to ensure operational alignment and efficiency in the field.


What You'll be Doing 
Business Development & Growth:


	Identify and explore opportunities for sourcing MSW and other municipal waste materials for use as alternate fuels.
	Assist in preparing proposals and business cases for new waste streams and co-processing initiatives.
	Drive revenue growth by expanding Geocycle’s customer and waste supplier portfolio across Nigeria.
	Conduct regular market intelligence and competitor analysis to inform strategic positioning. Stakeholder Engagement
	Engage with municipalities, waste contractors, and private waste collectors to secure MSW supply.
	Support relationship management with regulatory agencies and NGOs involved in waste and environmental matters.
	Support contract negotiations, MOUs, and partnerships that promote Geocycle’s sustainable waste management initiatives.
	Work with internal teams across logistics, operations, and sustainability to support delivery of MSW alternate fuel goals.


Project Management & Execution:


	Support implementation of new MSW supply streams, including site visits, quality checks, and coordination with operations teams.
	Monitor pre-processing and logistics to ensure material specifications are met for co-processing.
	Address operational bottlenecks in collaboration with field teams and logistics partners.


Compliance & Risk Awareness:


	Ensure all business development activities align with Lafarge’s HSE, sustainability, and ethical standards.
	Conduct due diligence on new partners and materials to mitigate operational and reputational risks.


Reporting & Performance Monitoring:


	Track business development KPIs including volume sourced, customer retention, and cost efficiency.
	Prepare monthly reports and presentations for leadership and regional business reviews.
	Share insights and learnings from the field to inform continuous improvement.


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	Bachelor's Degree in Environmental Science, Engineering, Waste Management, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum of 5–7 years of experience in municipal solid waste management, alternative fuels, or sustainability roles.
	Demonstrated expertise in project management, stakeholder engagement, and regulatory compliance
	Knowledge of safety rules and regulations
	Strong negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in waste processing technologies and waste-to-energy solutions.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Strong commercial acumen, stakeholder management, and project execution skills.
	Experience in the cement, energy, recycling, or manufacturing sector is highly desirable.


Key interfaces, stakeholders and relationships:


	Dotted Reporting Line – Geocycle Operations Manager
	The incumbent interacts regularly with all cadres of staff.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Field Enumerator Job at Emmix Global Limited




        
    

        
        Emmix global limited offers consultancy on conceptualization, development and project management services for independent hotel,restaurant and bar owners. It is most ideal if Emmix global limited is involved from the early stages of a project to enable our team to guide the development of the project. This usually also to ensure the brand philosophy and values have influence over various facets of the project to deliver a holistic and exceptional finished product

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Enumerator
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Contract Type: 30 Days renewable based on performance.

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Conduct farmer registration and field data collection using mobile devices.
	Administer questionnaires and capture accurate geo-data.
	Support monitoring and evaluation activities.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND in Agriculture, Social Sciences, or a related field.
	Must own a functional smartphone with internet access.
	Tech-savvy and comfortable with mobile data collection tools.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to: hr@maxgrow.ng using the Job Position and Phone Number as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply
